item.title: 2 Kings 1
item.description: v1 Moab rebelled against Israel after the death of Ahab.

item.title: 2 Kings 2
item.description: v1 When Yahweh was about to take Elijah up by a whirlwind into heaven, Elijah went with Elisha from Gilgal.

item.title: 2 Kings 3
item.description: v1 Now Jehoram the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned twelve years.

item.title: 2 Kings 4
item.description: v1 Now a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets cried out to Elisha, saying, “Your servant my husband is dead.

item.title: 2 Kings 5
item.description: v1 Now Naaman, captain of the army of the king of Syria, was a great man with his master, and honorable, because by him Yahweh had given victory to Syria: he was also a mighty man of valor, but he was a leper.

item.title: 2 Kings 6
item.description: v1 The sons of the prophets said to Elisha, “See now, the place where we live and meet with you is too small for us.

item.title: 2 Kings 7
item.description: v1 Elisha said, “Hear Yahweh’s word. Yahweh says, ‘Tomorrow about this time a seah of fine flour will be sold for a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel, in the gate of Samaria.

item.title: 2 Kings 8
item.description: v1 Now Elisha had spoken to the woman whose son he had restored to life, saying, “Arise, and go, you and your household, and stay for a while wherever you can; for Yahweh has called for a famine.

item.title: 2 Kings 9
item.description: v1 Elisha the prophet called one of the sons of the prophets, and said to him, “Put your belt on your waist, take this vial of oil in your hand, and go to Ramoth Gilead.

item.title: 2 Kings 10
item.description: v1 Now Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. Jehu wrote letters, and sent to Samaria, to the rulers of Jezreel, even the elders, and to those who brought up Ahab’s sons, saying,

item.title: 2 Kings 11
item.description: v1 Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the royal offspring.

item.title: 2 Kings 12
item.description: v1 Jehoash began to reign in the seventh year of Jehu, and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem.

item.title: 2 Kings 13
item.description: v1 In the twenty-third year of Joash the son of Ahaziah, king of Judah, Jehoahaz the son of Jehu began to reign over Israel in Samaria for seventeen years.

item.title: 2 Kings 14
item.description: v1 In the second year of Joash son of Joahaz king of Israel, Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah began to reign.

item.title: 2 Kings 15
item.description: v1 In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel, Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah began to reign.

item.title: 2 Kings 16
item.description: v1 In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah, Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.

item.title: 2 Kings 17
item.description: v1 In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah, Hoshea the son of Elah began to reign in Samaria over Israel for nine years.

item.title: 2 Kings 18
item.description: v1 Now in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.

item.title: 2 Kings 19
item.description: v1 When king Hezekiah heard it, he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into Yahweh’s house.

item.title: 2 Kings 20
item.description: v1 In those days Hezekiah was sick and dying. Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came to him, and said to him, “Yahweh says, ‘Set your house in order; for you will die, and not live.

item.title: 2 Kings 21
item.description: v1 Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and he reigned fifty-five years in Jerusalem.

item.title: 2 Kings 22
item.description: v1 Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned thirty-one years in Jerusalem.

item.title: 2 Kings 23
item.description: v1 The king sent, and they gathered to him all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem.

item.title: 2 Kings 24
item.description: v1 In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up, and Jehoiakim became his servant three years.

item.title: 2 Kings 25
item.description: v1 In the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and encamped against it; and they built forts against it around it.
